selectedVerses.text: "And if a man has committed a crime punishable by death and he is put to death, and you hang him on a tree,

"A single witness shall not suffice against a person for any crime or for any wrong in connection with any offense that he has committed. Only on the evidence of two witnesses or of three witnesses shall a charge be established.
For that would be a heinous crime; that would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges;
For their crime will they escape? In wrath cast down the peoples, O God!
But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, "If it were a matter of wrongdoing or vicious crime, O Jews, I would have reason to accept your complaint.
